Docs.summary: This annotation can be used on an android.test.InstrumentationTestCase's test methods.

remarks.para: This annotation can be used on an android.test.InstrumentationTestCase's test methods. When the annotation is present, the test method is re-executed if the test fails. The total number of executions is specified by the tolerance and defaults to 1.

This member is deprecated. Use
FlakyTest instead. New tests should be written using the Android Testing Support Library.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 Tolerance() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates how many times a test can run and fail before being reported as a failed test.
Docs.returns: The total number of allowed run, the default is 1.

remarks.para: Indicates how many times a test can run and fail before being reported as a failed test. If the tolerance factor is less than 1, the test runs only once.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
